column2: S1
column3: S2

column2: Would you like to go out to drink with me tonight?
column3: I really don't know what to eat tonight so I might go out somewhere.

column2: I advise you to treat this matter very seriously as it is vital.
column3: You must take this most seriously, it will affect you.

column2: When I was going out to meet my friends there was a delay at the train station.
column3: The train operator announced to the passengers that the train would be delayed.

column2: Does music help you to relax, or does it distract you too much?
column3: Does this sponge look wet or dry to you?

column2: You must realise that you will definitely be punished if you play with the alarm.
column3: He will be harshly punished for setting the fire alarm off.

column2: I will make you laugh so much that your sides ache.
column3: When I tell you this you will split your sides laughing.

column2: You shouldn't be covering what you really feel.
column3: There is no point in covering up what you said, we all know.

column2: Do you want to come with us to the pub behind the hill?
column3: We are going out for drinks tonight in Salford Quays if you would like to come.

column2: This key doesn't seem to be working, could you give me another?
column3: I dislike the word quay, it confuses me, I always think of things for locks, there's another one.

column2: The ghost appeared from nowhere and frightened the old man.
column3: The ghost of Queen Victoria appears to me every night, I don't know why, I don't even like the royals

column2: You're not a good friend if you're not prepared to be present when I need you.
column3: A good friend always seems to be present when you need them.

column2: The children crossed the road very safely thanks to the help of the lollipop lady.
column3: It was feared that the child might not recover, because he was seriously ill.

column2: I have invited a variety of people to my party so it should be interesting.
column3: A number of invitations were given out to a variety of people inviting them down the pub.

column2: I offer my condolences to the parents of John Smith, who was unfortunately murdered.
column3: I express my sympathy to John Smith’s parents following his murder.

column2: Boats come in all shapes and sizes but they all do the same thing.
column3: Chairs can be comfy and not comfy, depending on the chair.

column2: If you continuously use these products, I guarantee you will look very young.
column3: I assure you that, by using these products consistently over a long period of time, you will appear really young.

column2: We ran farther than the other children that day.
column3: You ran farther than anyone today.

column2: I always like to have a slice of lemon in my drink especially if it's Coke.
column3: I like to put a wedge of lemon in my drinks, especially cola.

column2: It seems like I've got eczema on my ear doctor, can you recommend something for me?
column3: I had to go to a chemist for a special rash cream for my ear.

column2: I am proud of our nation, well, most of it.
column3: I think of myself as being part of a nation.

column2: There was a heap of rubble left by the builders outside my house this morning.
column3: Sometimes in a large crowd accidents may happen, which can cause deadly injuries.

column2: Water freezes at a certain temperature, which is zero degrees Celsius.
column3: The temperature of boiling water is 100 C and the temperature of ice is 0 C.

column2: We got home safely in the end, although it was a long journey.
column3: Though it took many hours travel, we finally reached our house safely.

column2: A man called Dave gave his fiancée a large diamond ring for their engagement.
column3: The man presented a diamond to the woman and asked her to marry him.

column2: I used to run quite a lot, in fact once I ran for North Tyneside.
column3: I used to climb lots at school as we had a new climbing wall put in the gym.

column2: I love to laugh as it makes me happy as well as those around me.
column3: I thought we bargained that it would only cost me a pound.

column2: Because I am the eldest one I should be more responsible.
column3: Just because of my age, people shouldn't think I'm a responsible adult, but they do?

column2: I need to dash into the kitchen because I think my chip pan is on fire.
column3: In the event of a chip pan fire follow the instructions on the safety note.

column2: Peter was a very large youth, whose size intimidated most people, much to his delight.
column3: Now I wouldn't say he was fat, but I'd certainly say he was one of the larger boys.

column2: I'm going to buy a grey jumper today, in half an hour.
column3: That's a nice grey top, where did you get it from?
